intro: Gilia inconspicua subvar. diffusa, commonly known as the slender gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. The plant produces showy, bright pink or red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture. The species is characterized by its delicate appearance and is often found in disturbed or arid environments.
